text: Miriama Rauhihi-Ness (née Rauhihi; 15 July 1951 – 15 March 2021), also known as Ama Ness, was a New Zealand Māori activist and social worker. She helped organize the Polynesian Panthers, and 1975 Māori land march. She was a member of Ngā Tamatoa, which advocated for making Māori an official language. == Family == She married Tigilau Ness; they had a son, Che Fu. == References == Category:1951 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Māori rights activists
title: Miriama Rauhihi-Ness
